intro: Lastreopsis exculta, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
